column4: running the command "/etc/init.d/gdm start" causes my screen to go blank, any ideas?
Does anyone have any idea's as to why my screen goes blank when booting ubuntu 7.0.4 normally, but if I boot into recovery mode, and then "startx" it works?  I am using the 'ati' drivers
At the grub menu press "e" to edit the first line, then e again to edit the line with "splash" in it and delete the "splash"
